title.rendered: India vs New Zealand, 2nd T20I, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

India: Ishan Kishan (wk), Shubman Gill, Rahul Tripathi, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya (c), Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav, Umran Malik, Arshdeep Singh

New Zealand: Finn Allen, Devon Conway (wk), Mark Chapman, Daryl Mitchell, Glenn Phillips, Mitchell Santner (c), Michael Bracewell, Jacob Duffy, Ish Sodhi, Lockie Ferguson, Blair Tickner

Venue: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 167

2nd innings average score: 124

Wickets per innings: 6

Wins

Batting 1st: 100%

Batting 2nd: —

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In the current line-up, Suryakumar Yadav has the best average (47) against New Zealand. In 6 innings, he has accumulated 234 runs including the highest score of 111.

For New Zealand, Mitchell Santner is the leading wicket-taker against India. He has bagged 18 wickets including the best figures of 4 for 11.

Devon Conway has taken a liking to the Indian bowlers. In 4 innings, he has collected 138 runs at 46, including consecutive half-centuries.

Mark Chapman has been experiencing a lean run with the bat lately, averaging only 9 in his last 5 T20s.

One five-wicket haul and two three-wicket hauls were registered at the venue in the last three games. All belonged to seamers.

Spinners could not make merry in the last three games at Lucknow, as only 13% of the wickets belonged to them.

In the same period, an average of only 4 sixes per innings were hit.
